question.text: To answer a call on your mobile phone while travelling you should

explanation.text: No phone call is important enough to risk endangering lives. It’s better to switch your phone off completely when driving. If you must be contactable plan your route to include breaks so you can catch up on messages in safety. Always choose a safe and convenient place to take a break, such as a lay-by or service area.

answer.text: reduce your speed wherever you are
stop in a proper and convenient place
keep the call time to a minimum
